item.title: The “stay at home girlfriend” trend
item.description:
Lauren Chen on Twitter

“TikTok is full of attractive, young women calling themselves “stay-at-home-girlfriends” They don’t go to work, and spend all day at home spending their boyfriends’ money and doing household chores Predictably, feminists are furious about it. But is this trend such a bad thing?”

URL: https://twitter.com/TheLaurenChen/status/1610337205171388417

source: Wednesday assorted links

item.title: How much are Russian cyberattacks diminishing?
item.description:
Matthew Mittelsteadt on Twitter

“Russian cyber attacks on Ukraine have dramatically dropped off since the start of the war. People rarely acknowledge that cyberweapons are not endless and renewing the supply is extremely difficult. Once you use your attacks, they are gone. Looks like Russia’s arsenal is emptying”

URL: https://twitter.com/MattInThemittel/status/1610659036516712450

source: Wednesday assorted links

item.title: chat bot vs. the doctors

Ethan Mollick on Twitter

“Extraordinary new paper from Google on medicine & AI: When Google tuned a AI chatbot to answer common medical questions, doctors judged 92.6% of its answers right … compared to 92.9% of answers given by other doctors. And look at the pace of improvement! https://t.co/2Tc2YTUR6E”
